name: Arberry
text: When the Terror descends

name: Arberry
text: (and none denies its descending)

name: Arberry
text: abasing, exalting,

name: Arberry
text: when the earth shall be rocked

name: Arberry
text: and the mountains crumbled

name: Arberry
text: and become a dust, scattered,

name: Arberry
text: and you shall be three bands --

name: Arberry
text: Companions of the Right (O Companions of the Right!)

name: Arberry
text: Companions of the Left (O Companions of the Left!)

name: Arberry
text: and the Outstrippers: the Outstrippers

name: Arberry
text: those are they brought nigh the Throne,

name: Arberry
text: in the Gardens of Delight

name: Arberry
text: (a throng of the ancients

name: Arberry
text: and how few of the later folk)

name: Arberry
text: upon close-wrought couches

name: Arberry
text: reclining upon them, set face to face,

name: Arberry
text: immortal youths going round about them

name: Arberry
text: with goblets, and ewers, and a cup from a spring

name: Arberry
text: (no brows throbbing, no intoxication)

name: Arberry
text: and such fruits as they shall choose,

name: Arberry
text: and such flesh of fowl as they desire,

name: Arberry
text: and wide-eyed houris

name: Arberry
text: as the likeness of hidden pearls,

name: Arberry
text: a recompense for that they laboured.

name: Arberry
text: Therein they shall hear no idle talk, no cause of sin,

name: Arberry
text: only the saying 'Peace, Peace!'

name: Arberry
text: The Companions of the Right (O Companions of the Right!)

name: Arberry
text: mid thornless lote-trees

name: Arberry
text: and serried acacias,

name: Arberry
text: and spreading shade

name: Arberry
text: and outpoured waters,

name: Arberry
text: and fruits abounding

name: Arberry
text: unfailing, unforbidden,

name: Arberry
text: and upraised couches.

name: Arberry
text: Perfectly We formed them, perfect,

name: Arberry
text: and We made them spotless virgins,

name: Arberry
text: chastely amorous,

name: Arberry
text: like of age for the Companions of the Right.

name: Arberry
text: A throng of the ancients

name: Arberry
text: and a throng of the later folk.

name: Arberry
text: The Companions of the Left (O Companions of the Left!)

name: Arberry
text: mid burning winds and boiling waters

name: Arberry
text: and the shadow of a smoking blaze

name: Arberry
text: neither cool, neither goodly;

name: Arberry
text: and before that they lived at ease,

name: Arberry
text: and persisted in the Great Sin,

name: Arberry
text: ever saying, 'What, when we are dead and become dust and bones, shall we indeed be raised up?

name: Arberry
text: What, and our fathers, the ancients?'

name: Arberry
text: Say: 'The ancients, and the later folk

name: Arberry
text: shall be gathered to the appointed time of a known day.

name: Arberry
text: Then you erring ones, you that cried lies,

name: Arberry
text: you shall eat of a tree called Zakkoum,

name: Arberry
text: and you shall fill therewith your bellies

name: Arberry
text: and drink on top of that boiling water

name: Arberry
text: lapping it down like thirsty camels.'

name: Arberry
text: This shall be their hospitality on the Day of Doom.

name: Arberry
text: We created you; therefore why will you not believe?

name: Arberry
text: Have you considered the seed you spill?

name: Arberry
text: Do you yourselves create it, or are We the Creators?

name: Arberry
text: We have decreed among you Death; We shall not be outstripped;

name: Arberry
text: that We may exchange the likes of you, and make you to grow again in a fashion you know not.

name: Arberry
text: You have known the first growth; so why will you not remember?

name: Arberry
text: Have you considered the soil you till?

name: Arberry
text: Do you yourselves sow it, or are We the Sowers?

name: Arberry
text: Did We will, We would make it broken orts, and you would remain bitterly jesting --

name: Arberry
text: 'We are debt-loaded;

name: Arberry
text: nay, we have been robbed!'

name: Arberry
text: Have you considered the water you drink?

name: Arberry
text: Did you send it down from the clouds, or did We send it?

name: Arberry
text: Did We will, We would make it bitter; so why are you not thankful?

name: Arberry
text: Have you considered the fire you kindle?

name: Arberry
text: Did you make its timber to grow, or did We make it?

name: Arberry
text: We Ourselves made it for a reminder, and a boon to the desert-dwellers.

name: Arberry
text: Then magnify the Name of thy Lord, the All-mighty.

name: Arberry
text: No! I swear by the fallings of the stars

name: Arberry
text: (and that is indeed a mighty oath, did you but know it)

name: Arberry
text: it is surely a noble Koran

name: Arberry
text: in a hidden Book

name: Arberry
text: none but the purified shall touch,

name: Arberry
text: a sending down from the Lord of all Being.

name: Arberry
text: What, do you hold this discourse in disdain,

name: Arberry
text: and do you make it your living to cry lies?

name: Arberry
text: Why, but when the soul leaps to the throat of the dying

name: Arberry
text: and that hour you are watching

name: Arberry
text: (And We are nigher him than you, but you do not see Us)

name: Arberry
text: why, if you are not at Our disposal,

name: Arberry
text: do you not bring back his soul, if you speak truly?

name: Arberry
text: Then, if he be of those brought nigh the Throne,

name: Arberry
text: there shall be repose and ease, and a Garden of Delight;

name: Arberry
text: and if he be a Companion of the Right:

name: Arberry
text: 'Peace be upon thee, Companion of the Right!'

name: Arberry
text: But if he be of them that cried lies, and went astray,

name: Arberry
text: there shall be a hospitality of boiling water

name: Arberry
text: and the roasting in Hell.

name: Arberry
text: Surely this is the truth of certainty.

name: Arberry
text: Then magnify the Name of thy Lord, the All-mighty.
